oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lawyers; Judicial proceedings; Legislators
Bryan, William Jennings, 1860-1925; Evolution - Religious aspects; Evolution (Biology) - Study and teaching - Law and legislation
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: William Jennings Bryan and John Washington Butler seated at a table.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Undated; W. E. Barr
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: John W. Butler (1875-1952) represented Macon, Trousdale, and Sumner Counties in the Tennessee House and Senate; he was the author of the state anti-evolution law. William Jennings Bryan served as the chief prosecution attorney for the Scopes Trial.
